summary.p: 5 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 47; Qurʾānic Text: Q 14:5-15:60; 15 lines per page; Dimensions: 190 x 129mm; Script style: kūfī D.Va.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
5 fol. 129×190 mm (1.47). Support: thin transparent parchment, dark, grayish on the flesh side. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: fragment of a quire, fol. 2–3 – central bifolium, the rest are singletons with stubs, S H1F S H2F / F3H S F4H F5H.

Text layout: 73×140 mm (1.875), 15 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D Va, small and compact. Diacritics: occasional diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: red and green dots, either round or quite shapeless.

Verse markers: for groups of five verses – yellow letter ﻪ (hā) in the text line (fol. 1v, 2v, 3r, 4r, 5r, 5v); for groups of ten verses – colorful medallions (types 1.A.I and 2.A.II?), on the margins or in the text line.
A large round medallion drawn in red, green and yellow paints with the inscribed words السبع الثالث marks the border between the 2nd and 3d sub‘ (on-seventh part of the text) on fol. 2v.
Title of surah 15 (الحجر تسعون وتسع اية) is written in yellow paint (fol. 4r).
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs inscribed on the upper margins of fol. 3v and 4r in Roman numerals; the number of surah 15 also inscribed on the outer margin of fol. 4r next to the heading.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold.
Traces of old conservation: outer margins have probably been trimmed; some lines are erased and rewritten in similar ink.
Old accession numbers: B. 25 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–4r. Surah 14, verses 5(5)-52(52)*. Incipit: [أرسلنا موسى باياتنا] أن اخرج قومك .
Fol. 4r–5v. Surah 15, verses 1(1)-60(60). Explicit: إلاّ امرأته [قدرنا انها لمن] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
